<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/06/western-countries-will-likely-administer-first-covid19-vaccines-week?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Shots Shots Shots Shots Shots Shots
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Russian vaccine " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzI2L3J1c3NpYW5fdmFjY2luZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>KIRILL KUDRYAVTSEV/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, Western nations are set to administer their first doses of the coronavirus vaccine, capping a remarkable scientific achievement that will save an untold number of lives and help the global economy recover from a historic recession.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some countries have already started their vaccine programs. Russia began </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-55198166?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">inoculating</a></span><span> its citizens on Saturday with its Sputnik V vaccine, and about </span><span><a href="https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/12/04/1013183/us-uk-and-china-covid-vaccine-who-gets-priority-decision/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">1 million Chinese people</a></span><span> have already been vaccinated. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The arrival of vaccines marks the beginning of the end of this dark chapter in human history, but also the beginning of the beginning. In the U.S., priority will be given to healthcare workers and residents of long-term-care facilities, and healthy folks might not receive a vaccine until April. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The debate over timing</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Thursday, the FDA is expected to vote on approving the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine for emergency use, and it could be administered to Americans the next day.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The timing of that vote has been controversial. The UK <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/pfizer-and-biontechs-covid-19-vaccine-wins-u-k-authorization-11606893360?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">approved</a> the same vaccine last Wednesday, and is set to start inoculating people tomorrow, a few days ahead of the U.S. Some experts <a href="https://www.statnews.com/2020/12/04/how-key-decisions-slowed-fdas-review-of-covid-19-vaccine-but-also-gave-it-important-data/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">questioned</a> why the FDA would wait weeks after Pfizer asked for approval (Nov. 20) to hold a vote as thousands of Americans die from Covid every day. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>FDA insiders told Stat News this interim time period was necessary to analyze the raw data and give the vaccine the thorough check it needs, considering it’ll be administered to hundreds of millions of people.  </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In further defense of the FDA’s process, last week the U.S.’ top infectious disease official, Dr. Anthony Fauci, called the UK ruling “</span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-55177948?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rushed</a></span><span>,” which ticked off some British health officials. Fauci later apologized and said UK regulators had his full confidence. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Investors have been zeroed in on the promising news of the Covid-19 vaccines while mostly ignoring the U.S.’ spiraling outbreak and bleak jobs report from Friday. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F12%2F06%2Fwestern-countries-will-likely-administer-first-covid19-vaccines-week" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=The+FDA+was+forced+to+defend+the+timeline+of+its+review+process+&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/06/western-countries-will-likely-administer-first-covid19-vaccines-week&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SMALL BIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/07/new-california-covid19-restrictions-face-pushback-small-businesses?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Lots of Coronavirus and Outrage in California
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Closed playground" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzI3L2Nsb3NlZF9wbGF5Z3JvdW5kLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Los Angeles Times via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As of 11:59pm last night, 33 million Californians, about 84% of the state’s population, were subject to new <a href="https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2020-12-06/california-new-stay-at-home-order?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stay-at-home restrictions</a> aimed at preventing a Covid-19 catastrophe at hospitals.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Those restrictions, which are triggered when a region’s ICU capacity falls below 15%, require a halt to in-person dining and the closure of businesses such as wineries, nail salons, and zoos. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many business owners are outraged with what they say are exceedingly strict and randomly applied rules. In a video that went viral Saturday, a Sherman Oaks restaurant owner <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/05/us/outdoor-dining-la-protest.html?smtyp=cur&smid=tw-nytimes&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">showed</a> a catering tent set up for a film crew (allowed, since entertainment workers are considered essential in California) right next door to her own outdoor dining patio, which sits empty because of the ban.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The county health department responded that, unlike diners, film crews are regularly tested for Covid and must follow other strict health practices.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>California leaders are struggling to address the growing public health crisis (LA County hit a record number of cases four times last week) and simmering anger from devastated small businesses.  </p>

</a><span>  </span>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COMMODITIES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/06/metals-prices-surge-manufacturing-kicks-high-gear?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Metals Show Their Mettle
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While the bitcoin vs. gold debate has grabbed the attention of metalheads recently, less precious metals like copper, iron ore, and nickel have quietly been some of the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/soaring-metals-prices-signal-bets-on-global-economic-recovery-11607250600?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best-performing assets</a> of the year, the WSJ reports. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Prices of raw materials tend to rise when the U.S. and China are playing nice in the trade sandbox, but most importantly, when they’re making a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/manufacturers-fare-better-than-many-service-providers-in-covid-19-economy-11604745000?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lot of stuff</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Demand for electric cars and new homes, in particular, has turned manufacturing into the LeBron of the global economy, carrying the J.R. Smiths—travel, leisure, and services. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, the U.S. and China’s geopolitical game of chicken led to uncertainty for mining companies, which slowed investment in new mines from 2016 on. Now, prices are skyrocketing because demand is far outstripping supply.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>appetite for metals is <a href="https://www.fool.com/investing/2020/12/01/copper-prices-are-on-fire/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">growing</a> as more countries invest in renewable energy systems like wind turbines which are “at least five times more copper-intensive than conventional power,” according to a report from Jefferies. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY BOMBAS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Holidays Are Afoot
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://bombas.com/pages/6-reasons-why?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_content=holiday-primary-b" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Bombas" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMTY1MS8xNjA1ODE5MjA5LU1vcm5pbmdCcmV3LUFsdC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This holiday season, we’re thinking on our feet and treating everybody on our list—ourselves included—to the supreme comfort of <a href="https://bombas.com/pages/6-reasons-why?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_content=holiday-primary-b" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bombas</a> socks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Everyone has a <em>thing</em>. And Bombas are <a href="https://bombas.com/pages/6-reasons-why?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_content=holiday-primary-b" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the perfect gift</a> to say, “Hey, I remember that <em>thing</em>.” Whether it's gripper socks for the yoga addict, hiking socks for the nature lover, or Merino Wool socks and tees for those who love to be cozy from head to toe. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Plus, when you give the gift of Bombas, they donate a pair to someone in need</strong>—so every pair you give doubles as a gift for someone else's feet too. They’ve donated over 40 million pairs of socks so far.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">From festive snowflake patterns to perfectly-picked gift boxes, <a href="https://bombas.com/pages/6-reasons-why?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_content=holiday-primary-b" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stock your stockings with the gift of Bombas</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Get <a href="https://bombas.com/pages/6-reasons-why?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=scontent&utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_content=holiday-primary-b" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">20% off your first order</a> with code <strong style="color:#000">BREW </strong>today.</p>

<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/06/coastal-carolina-vs-byu-arranged-last-minute?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Feel-Good Football Story
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Road trip" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzI0L3JvYWRfdHJpcC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Google Maps</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This global pandemic has given us a few magical moments you have to savor. The most recent happened Saturday night, when Brigham Young University played Coastal Carolina in a college football game dubbed “Mormons vs. Mullets.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These two teams were <a href="https://www.deseret.com/sports/2020/12/3/22150164/byu-football-coastal-carolina-tom-holmoe-liberty-football-ian-mccaw-college-football-playoff?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not supposed to play</a> one another. Earlier in the week, Liberty University had to cancel on Coastal because of a Covid-19 outbreak, and Coastal needed to find an opponent—ideally a good one, considering the team was undefeated and wanted to beef up its résumé.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Enter BYU, whose program also needed another marquee win. The two schools got to talking and on Thursday agreed that BYU would make the <a href="https://www.si.com/college/2020/12/03/byu-equipment-truck-coastal-carolina-football-schedule?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cross-country trip</a> to play Coastal in Conway, South Carolina, not far from Myrtle Beach.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The matchup was helped along by ESPN execs, who know a thing or two about programming flexibility during the pandemic. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And the game itself was thrilling—Coastal Carolina eked out a win that came down to the last play. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Sports leagues and TV networks have learned that, without a bubble, you should prepare for logistical headaches. A few days ago, the NBA released <a href="https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/30450339/nba-releases-first-half-regular-season-schedule?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">only half</a> of its regular-season schedule to give itself the wiggle room the NFL <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/30/sports/football/san-francisco-49ers-arizona-stadium.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wishes it had</a>.  </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">IPOs: </strong>The IPO bonanza we’ve been talking about for months is <a href="https://www.renaissancecapital.com/IPO-Center/News/73781/US-IPO-Week-Ahead-DoorDash-and-Airbnb-kick-off-the-unicorn-parade-in-a-6-IP?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">finally here</a>. Airbnb, one of the U.S.’ most valuable private startups, is expected to start trading on Thursday at a market cap of more than $31 billion. Food delivery giant DoorDash could be worth even more than that when it goes public on Wednesday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stimulus: </strong>Talks picked up momentum last week after top Democrats supported a compromise bill with a much lighter price tag. At the same time, lawmakers must pass a spending measure to avert a government shutdown on Friday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>There aren’t any blockbusters this week, but some interesting companies reporting quarterly financials include Stitch Fix (Monday); Chewy (Tuesday); and Lululemon, Costco, and Oracle (Thursday).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Economic data: </strong>We’ll learn more about inflation with the Consumer Price Index reading on Thursday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Today is the anniversary of the attack on Pearl Harbor in 1941. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Hanukkah starts at sundown on Thursday.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The videogame </span><span><em>Cyberpunk 2077 </em></span><span><span>will be released on Thursday after several delays and an astronomical budget.</span></span><span>

</li>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

And they’re kicking off this week at record highs.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBrexit: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe UK and the EU are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-eu-talks/on-a-knife-edge-britain-and-eu-in-last-ditch-trade-talks-idUSKBN28F0SY?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eracing\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to strike an agreement this week to avoid a “no deal” Brexit that could cause chaos for the British economy and the markets. If you can remember, the actual Brexit referendum took place in June 2016.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nPHARMA \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/06/western-countries-will-likely-administer-first-covid19-vaccines-week?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nShots Shots Shots Shots Shots Shots\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Russian vaccine \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzI2L3J1c3NpYW5fdmFjY2luZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eKIRILL KUDRYAVTSEV/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis week, Western nations are set to administer their first doses of the coronavirus vaccine, capping a remarkable scientific achievement that will save an untold number of lives and help the global economy recover from a historic recession.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSome countries have already started their vaccine programs. Russia began \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-55198166?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einoculating\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e its citizens on Saturday with its Sputnik V vaccine, and about \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/12/04/1013183/us-uk-and-china-covid-vaccine-who-gets-priority-decision/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e1 million Chinese people\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e have already been vaccinated. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe arrival of vaccines marks the beginning of the end of this dark chapter in human history, but also the beginning of the beginning. In the U.S., priority will be given to healthcare workers and residents of long-term-care facilities, and healthy folks might not receive a vaccine until April. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe debate over timing\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Thursday, the FDA is expected to vote on approving the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine for emergency use, and it could be administered to Americans the next day.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe timing of that vote has been controversial. The UK \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/pfizer-and-biontechs-covid-19-vaccine-wins-u-k-authorization-11606893360?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapproved\u003c/a\u003e the same vaccine last Wednesday, and is set to start inoculating people tomorrow, a few days ahead of the U.S. Some experts \u003ca href=\"https://www.statnews.com/2020/12/04/how-key-decisions-slowed-fdas-review-of-covid-19-vaccine-but-also-gave-it-important-data/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equestioned\u003c/a\u003e why the FDA would wait weeks after Pfizer asked for approval (Nov. 20) to hold a vote as thousands of Americans die from Covid every day. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFDA insiders told Stat News this interim time period was necessary to analyze the raw data and give the vaccine the thorough check it needs, considering it’ll be administered to hundreds of millions of people.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn further defense of the FDA’s process, last week the U.S.’ top infectious disease official, Dr. Anthony Fauci, called the UK ruling “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-55177948?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erushed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e,” which ticked off some British health officials. Fauci later apologized and said UK regulators had his full confidence. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eInvestors have been zeroed in on the promising news of the Covid-19 vaccines while mostly ignoring the U.S.’ spiraling outbreak and bleak jobs report from Friday. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs of 11:59pm last night, 33 million Californians, about 84% of the state’s population, were subject to new \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2020-12-06/california-new-stay-at-home-order?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estay-at-home restrictions\u003c/a\u003e aimed at preventing a Covid-19 catastrophe at hospitals.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThose restrictions, which are triggered when a region’s ICU capacity falls below 15%, require a halt to in-person dining and the closure of businesses such as wineries, nail salons, and zoos. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMany business owners are outraged with what they say are exceedingly strict and randomly applied rules. In a video that went viral Saturday, a Sherman Oaks restaurant owner \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/05/us/outdoor-dining-la-protest.html?smtyp=cur\u0026smid=tw-nytimes\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshowed\u003c/a\u003e a catering tent set up for a film crew (allowed, since entertainment workers are considered essential in California) right next door to her own outdoor dining patio, which sits empty because of the ban.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe county health department responded that, unlike diners, film crews are regularly tested for Covid and must follow other strict health practices.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eCalifornia leaders are struggling to address the growing public health crisis (LA County hit a record number of cases four times last week) and simmering anger from devastated small style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis global pandemic has given us a few magical moments you have to savor. The most recent happened Saturday night, when Brigham Young University played Coastal Carolina in a college football game dubbed “Mormons vs. Mullets.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThese two teams were \u003ca href=\"https://www.deseret.com/sports/2020/12/3/22150164/byu-football-coastal-carolina-tom-holmoe-liberty-football-ian-mccaw-college-football-playoff?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot supposed to play\u003c/a\u003e one another. Earlier in the week, Liberty University had to cancel on Coastal because of a Covid-19 outbreak, and Coastal needed to find an opponent—ideally a good one, considering the team was undefeated and wanted to beef up its résumé.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEnter BYU, whose program also needed another marquee win. The two schools got to talking and on Thursday agreed that BYU would make the \u003ca href=\"https://www.si.com/college/2020/12/03/byu-equipment-truck-coastal-carolina-football-schedule?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecross-country trip\u003c/a\u003e to play Coastal in Conway, South Carolina, not far from Myrtle Beach.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe matchup was helped along by ESPN execs, who know a thing or two about programming flexibility during the pandemic. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd the game itself was thrilling—Coastal Carolina eked out a win that came down to the last play. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eSports leagues and TV networks have learned that, without a bubble, you should prepare for logistical headaches. A few days ago, the NBA released \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/30450339/nba-releases-first-half-regular-season-schedule?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonly half\u003c/a\u003e of its regular-season schedule to give itself the wiggle room the NFL \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/30/sports/football/san-francisco-49ers-arizona-stadium.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewishes it had\u003c/a\u003e.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\"
